alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 26 at 3:46AM EST until January 27 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Scattered to numerous snow showers leading to accumulations of a dusting to 1 inch at 2000 feet elevation and below and 1 to 2 inches above 2000 feet, especially on grassy and elevated surfaces. Locally higher amounts are possible above 3000 feet in the Black Mountain region. * WHERE...Harlan and Letcher Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions near 2000 feet elevation and above. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and/or evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow could impact the higher elevation roadways, especially those near and above 2000 feet, including US-23 near the VA state line, US-119 and US 421 crossing Pine Mountain, portions of KY-179 between Cumberland and Louellen, portions of KY-160 in Harlan and Letcher Counties, KY-38 in Harlan County, and KY-932 at Flat Gap near the VA border.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Kentucky can be found by visiting https://goky.ky.gov.
